comment: She is kind of an unrealistically hard grader BUT the class itself is a lot of fun. She offers ample amount of opportunity to fix any assignments that may have an issue.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: Overall she was nice and very clear about what she wants. Her tests are very textbook and lecture based. You HAVE to read and watch the videos and book in order to pass, trust me. Her VCIA's (discussion posts) were very fun and interactive and the course is not super hard. You should take her.

You need discipline to take this class! For an online course, Johnson was very present & caring (but strict) with students! There's an unbelievable amount of reading, so if that's your thing, have at it. Very fun weekly graphic design assignments, occasional tests and a paper at the end of the year. Watch the videos & READ!! Both are in the tests!
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: She does not care about you as a student at all. She sets unreasonable deadlines and never gives clear directions. She never tells you about any of the quizzes; you are just expected to know that the quizzes are open. She will let you fail no questions asked.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: This is the most work I've had to put into an online class, but that isn't really a bad thing. Her weekly lectures were interesting, but the schedule of the modules is tough to work with especially if you're taking it online for async purposes (tests and discussions open on weird days). Strict with deadlines and tests are tough. VCIAs were fun!

insanely time consuming class. lectures arent clear at all and its so hard to study for her quizzes. her modules are only open to fit her schedule, so definitely dont take this class if you work full time and are in school. the VCIA's for each week require a lot of work. reading heavy class. lectures are mainly youtube videos. no study guides.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: If I could take her for all my PR classes I would! Legit the best teacher I have ever had. While I did have prior knowledge to adobe/graphic design she is so helpful even if you don't. If you have to take a PR credit take this course you won't regret it at all!!
I loved Professor Johnson! She loves her students, the material, teaching, and seeing her class succeed! We all learned so much and had a great time doing it! Take her classes! You won't regret it!

I loved not only this class but Prof. Johnson! If you can take her, DO IT!! She is accommodating with assignments and cares about improving your design skills. However, while I had a great time due to liking the arts and being creative, I would look elsewhere if you need help with design or are just looking for a class for credit.

Professor Johnson was passionate about the course material. She has 3 "quizzes" that are basically tests & a huge part of your grade. I feel like the quizzes cover way too many chapters of content. The questions will be specific lines of text from chapters and not general questions about course concepts, I'd get a low B after studying for hours
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: Loved her! Her quizzes were fairly challenging. You have to really read the textbook chapters (which are super long) in order to do well on the quizzes. Overall, she's great. She's super sweet.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria

comment: If you do all of the work on time, you should get a pretty good grade. My only problem was that my laptop crashed and I had to go to best buy and have it repaired, which made me end up turning in an assignment 4 hours late and she took off 5 points. There are 4 quizzes, 5 discussion posts, and 1 final project. You will need to buy the book!

This class requires genuine effort, but you will come out with enough graphic design skills for almost any communications job. I took it as an eight week summer session, and I feel like that was a good choice since this class demands time and energy. Professor Johnson gives great lectures, but the textbook was disorganized and poorly written IMO.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: She is a great professor. Read and watch all her videos. She gets very specific about those things on her quizzes. Also all her quizzes are only open on Sundays, so beware of that.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: The discussions were interesting and easy. There are two big projects - graded leniently and not too hard. Beware of the quizzes! The first wasn't bad, but the others were tough. Not too much reading, lectures and other content aren't too long. The hardest part was figuring out the programs used to generate the projects. No EC, so do your best.
Professor Johnson is an awesome teacher. I took her course online and didn't have a hard time.

She is an amazing professor and teaches this class so well. There are discussions posts and a handful of projects. No tests but there are three quizzes. She teaches you how to use InDesign and has lots of resources for you 10/10.

I had Professor Johnson as my Visual Communication professor. She was unbelievably caring even though I took her online class and made the class extremely interesting. We did have a lot of homework that included discussion posts every week and creative projects, but that comes with most college classes!

Please don't take Prof. Johnson, she is such a hard grader and makes the class unbearable. All her tests are hard, and even with the textbook it's difficult. Her videos are annoying, and the tests are where you can't go back and look at your answers. There are 2 stupid projects, and 3 tests that suck. If you value your sanity do NOT take her.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: Professor Johnson is really amazing! She really knows the content and her lectures are really interesting and clear. Class isn't hard, consists of weekly chapter readings and discussions. She is clear about grading criteria and if you do everything that's asked, you'll get an A. She responds to emails quickly and cares about her students. Take her!

Professor Johnson is a really nice teacher. Theres a discussion every week, 3 exams and a final. You do have to do some reading but not to much, as long as you know definitions its pretty easy. My test average was a b and I didnt do thst much reading. Youll have small projects. The biggest thing is to know apa style or loose a lot of points

Prof Johnson's class was pretty easy, but she does not give any leeway whatsoever. I had an 89.3 and asked for extra credit to bump up to an A and she wrote a shady announcement saying she does not offer extra credit at all. She was cool and all but I didn't appreciate the shade lol. Wish she offered extra credit.

Really easy class. Took online and usually there was only 1 discussion post due a week. There was 4 quizzes and an infographic. We had to watch a movie at the end of the semester and the last quiz was on it. Only used the textbook for homework once, I never bought it and borrow the pages from a friend.

Professor Johnson was amazing! The quizzes are difficult if you dont read and listen to her video lectures, but the course load is not heavy at all. She doesnt offer extra credit but it really isnt needed if you just do the work. short discussion each week, 3 quizzes, 2 projects, & a movie final. TAKE HER!!!!!!!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: One of the best online classes I have taken. Professor Johnson is very knowledgeable in this area, and she makes this class very manageable. You have a discussion post most weeks and a project occasionally. There are a few quizzes, but they are open note.

Took her class online and it was fairly easy. A couple of projects here and there that take up some time but nothing difficult. There were a few quizzes but if you listen to the lectures the answers are in them. Mostly the only real work you have to do for the week is a discussion post. She's a great teacher and the class is very managable.

She was honestly a wonderful teacher. I gained a lot of knowledge about adobe that is definitely resume worthy. I would have received an A if I hadn't misinterpreted her instructions for an assignment so be careful with that. She has only a couple of quizzes and major projects she grades on. Just have fun with the class!

Im not sure what the person below was talking about because he clearly didnt take Professor Johnson for 4405. She literally teaches you step-by-step how to use InDesign. She is patient and really cares about her students. Sounds like he didnt do well in her course and is writing a bad review to get back at her :-/

Magazine Media was my second course with Prof. Johnson, and I loved it! This class could be a little more organized, but each semester she makes it better. I really enjoyed working in a close-knit design team to create Pipeline, which is a fantastic resume/portfolio addition. Johnson is caring, patient, and always willing to help. Take her classes!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: I took Professor Johnson for a design class. The class is lecture heavy and filled with busy work. She would often make us figure out InDesign on our own and was not good at teaching or explaining. I would not take this professor again. I did not learn much in this class.

If you love being creative, you will love Publication Design. Class is composed of 4 main design projects and 2 quizzes- which aren't hard as long as you study. You can't wait until the last minute do get work done because design is time consuming, but the skills you learn here are super valuable. Prof Johnson is super nice, helpful, and patient!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Would take again

comment: I loved Prof. Johnson! She is cute, sweet, caring, and respectable. The class has a lot of assignments but they are not hard and she is always accessible for help and feedback. Johnson is understanding and she really cares about her students.

I absolutely LOVE Prof. Johnson. If you're a communication major this is definitely a class you should take. She has the patience of a SAINT and really works with students to make sure they understand the complicated systems. Creativity will definitely take you a long way in this course, but she lays out clear guidelines for what is expected.

She is the best. I did not think this class was hard at all. If you follow the guidelines than you will get an easy A. If you are not creative than this may not be your niche. She is very clear on what she expects and she is super fun and nice. 100% would take this class over a million times over.

Here's the class: some mini assignments (all easy), a few big projects, a big final project, and a few quizzes (which were kinda hard IMO). For the love of God, don't skip class. Design is hard. It's super time consuming. But what you learn from this class you'll use forever possibly.

She is a great professor if you are active in the class. Grades are all over the place if you ask her for help she will tell you whats wrong with your writing but when you get your grade back there will be errors that you didn't even know were there.  Stickler for AP style and teaches some outdated material (internship told me it was old)

I took this for a Maymester.  If you've never had any experience with graphic design, I wouldn't recommend a short semester for this class.  Take a full fall or spring semester.  She's a lot of fun, though, and the class is amazing.  She's very helpful and she really enjoys what she does.  Take her if you can.

We are over mid-semester and I have learned so much in this class already. We have a semester long project working with  a non-profit organization so it's really close to a PR agency setting. I wouldn't recommend skipping class. Prof. Johnson grades fairly. Getting an "A" can be challenging but she loves helping if you ask!

Took this class for a maymester and loved it. Very interesting. It is a lot of work but very do-able and fun. The teacher was great, although her valley girl voice got on my nerves a little bit. Overall a great class to take.

One of the best teachers ever. I have zero interest in the topic, but LOVED the class. I actually enjoyed learning how to use Photoshop and Adobe InDesign. A few minor quizzes, so it's good to take some notes. No exams. Just design projects, all solo and you can do them in class and/or at home. Very simple! One of the few COM classes I'd call fun.
She is one of my favorite COMM professors so far! She is extremely helpful and makes class fun. Take her for organizational publications and you'll get an easy A!

I took this class during Maymester and although it was A LOT of work, I learned so much and Mrs.Johnson was very helpful and patient with any questions. She is so nice and has a great sense of humor/sarcastic. One of the best professors I have ever had! I would take her again in a second!
